content_preview.summary: Dario Amodei rejected the Pentagon's 'final offer' on Claude's military use, triggering a supply chain risk designation and government-wide ban. Hours later, OpenAI struck a rival deal with identical safety principles—accepting the same terms Washington called unacceptable from Anthropic.
content_preview.body_excerpt:
## Overview

The months-long standoff between Anthropic and the U.S. Defense Department reached a definitive and consequential conclusion on February 27, 2026. CEO Dario Amodei refused the Pentagon's final contract offer, the Trump administration ordered all federal agencies to phase out Anthropic technology, and Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth declared the company a "supply chain risk" — a designation historically reserved for foreign adversaries. Hours later, OpenAI struck its own Pentagon deal...
